alert.note: Alert for McIntosh (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 16 at 2:21AM CDT until April 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HASKELL...NORTHEASTERN MCINTOSH...SOUTHWESTERN SEQUOYAH AND SOUTHEASTERN MUSKOGEE COUNTIES... At 220 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles southwest of Warner, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Stigler... Warner... Porum... Webbers Falls... Keota... Tamaha... Briartown... Kanima... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 269 and 290. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
